meanings.definition: A paste used to fill cracks or holes in walls.
meanings.sent1: I used spackle to fix the hole in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The painter applied spackle to the crack before painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to eat the spackle, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like spackle, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The spackle smoothed out the rough surface, making it look brand new.

meanings.definition: To fill or repair with spackle.
meanings.sent1: He will spackle the wall before painting it.
meanings.sent2: She carefully spackled the cracks in the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to spackle the broken toy back together.
meanings.sent4: His words spackled the relationship, mending the hurt feelings.
meanings.sent5: The chef spackled the cake layers with delicious frosting.
